newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RBNZ sees c/a deficit at NZ$4.0 bln by March 98.
newsitem.headline: RBNZ sees c/a deficit at NZ$4.0 bln by March 98.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand in its six monthly economic projections on Friday forecast the current account deficit to reach NZ$4.005 billion in the year to March 1998, or 4.2 percent of nominal GDP.
The bank said it projected the current account deficit to reach NZ$3.551 billion in the year to March 1997, or 3.8 percent of nominal GDP.
In March, the bank had forecast the deficit to peak at $4.9 billion in the March 1998 year.
Statistics New Zealand said the current account deficit was NZ$3.6 billion in the March year.
